TiE is recognized as the global organization fostering entrepreneurship through mentoring, networking and education. The purpose of TiE is to encourage and nurture the next generation of entrepreneurs and add to the virtuous cycle of wealth creation spurring development and economic growth in vibrant yet under-developed regions. The Indus Entrepreneurs (TiE), was founded in 1992 in Silicon Valley by a group of successful entrepreneurs, corporate executives, and senior professionals with roots in the Indus region. There are currently 15,000 members, including over 2,500 charter members in 61 chapters across 17 countries.
Enqos - a technology company building solutions that unlock the true potential of entrepreneurs

enqos was founded in 2010 with a vision to empower ideas by enabling entrepreneurs, innovators, and product leaders build and scale products more efficiently. We have stayed true to this vision and have been an integral part of engineering some really cool startups(some home grown) and enterprises building innovative products in the ad tech, cross-border commerce, eCommerce, domains, and CRM verticals. We have also built a digital team that works with some of the biggest brands in the world and is the backbone for running hundreds and thousands of PPC campaigns for small businesses in the US and Canada.SpecialtiesEcommerce, Social Platforms, Share Economy Marketplaces, Cross Border Commerce, Startup Incubation, Digital Solutions
Volunteer at TiE Angels Group Seattle (TAGS)

TiE Angels Group Seattle is the newest program from TiE Seattle. It is an angel investment group formed by Charter Members of TiE Seattle. TAGS typically invests in early stage companies seeking seed or Series A round funding.
Co-Founder - Sales & Operations (Online Fashion Retail Startup)

Runway2Street, is a curated, direct to consumer, SaaS enabled​ Marketplace for brands to sell to a global audience. We've been featured in international editions of Vogue, Elle, Grazia, Glamour, InStyle, Vanity Fair, Refinery29, Geekwire, Bloomberg, CNBC, FashInvest, Yahoo, Seattle Met. and more.
